key_points: A tornado confirmed to have touched down on Cape Cod as remnants of Hurricane Ida swept through New England.
Six tornado warnings were issued for the Cape and Islands, with warnings ending around 2:30 a.m.
The tornado, classified as EF-0, had maximum winds near 75 mph, causing damage in Dennis, MA.
Over 9 inches of rain reported in parts of New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, and Rhode Island.
Over 30,000 people were without power across southern New England during the storm.
Significant flooding reported, including three to four feet of water on Storrow Drive and multiple vehicles stuck in floodwaters.
Massachusetts Emergency Management Agency warns against driving or walking through flowing water.
MBTA and Amtrak services affected, with cancellations and suspensions due to flooding.
Flash flood warnings covered most of Massachusetts, Rhode Island, and Connecticut; severe weather expected to continue.
The storm caused historic flooding in New York City, with a record 3.15 inches of rain in one hour in Central Park.
